content:
• Tuesday, August 13, 2019
  • W

    Wayfair proposes $750M convertible debt offering

    • Wayfair (NYSE:W) has proposed an offering of $750M in convertible senior debt.
    • The notes would be due 2026 and come through a private offering; initial purchasers would get a 13-day option to buy up to an additional $112.5M in principal of the notes.
    • Shares are down 2.4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM | 12 Comments
  • HUYA

    Huya +6.2% as heavy revenue growth tops guidance

    • Huya (NYSE:HUYA) is 6.2% higher after hours following a beat in its Q2 earnings amid revenues that nearly doubled and the company swung to a profit.
    • Net revenues rose 93.6% to 2.01B yuan (about $292.9M), and GAAP net income was 121.8M yuan (about $17.7M) vs. a year-ago loss of 2.13B yuan.
    • Live-streaming revenues rose 93.7% to 1.92B yuan amid more users and higher spending; advertising and other revenues rose 91.3% to 89M yuan amid higher demand from gaming advertisers.
    • Non-GAAP net income rose 61.7% to 170.4M yuan.
    • In operations, average monthly active users rose 57.3% Y/Y to 143.9M. Average mobile MAUs rose 31.1% to 55.9M.
    • Paying users jumped 46.7% to 4.9M.
    • "During the second quarter, we strategically upgraded our monetization tactics for sustainable longer-term growth," says CFO Henry Sha. "Despite the seasonal impact, Huya still achieved fast growth in both traffic and revenue."
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 19 Comments
  • HUYA

    Huya Broadcasting EPS beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

  • LEGH

    Legacy Housing +1.9% as Q2 beats, strong orders continue

    • Legacy Housing (NASDAQ:LEGH) jumps 1.9% in after-hours trading after Q2 results beat consensus and the company sees strong order flow will continue into Q3 and through the rest of the year.
    • Q2 EPS of 35 cents beats the average analyst estimate of 31 cents and increased from 34 cents in the year-ago quarter.
    • Q2 revenue of $45.8M, exceeding the consensus estimate of $41.3M, rose 4% from $44.0M in Q2 2018.
    • Gross margin percentage increased to 29.9% from 23.2% due to price increases, increased sales to manufactured home parks, and increased company-owned retail sales directly to consumers.
    • Conference call on Aug. 14 at 11:00 AM ET.
    • Previously: Legacy Housing EPS beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Aug. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • CHNG

    Change Healthcare up 8% after hours on FQ1 beat

    • Change Healthcare (NASDAQ:CHNG) fiscal Q1 results:
    • Revenues: $855.6M (+4%); Solutions revenue: $797.1M (+5%).
    • Net income: $71.9M (+475%); non-GAAP net income: $141.5M (+45%); EPS: $0.28 (+460%); non-GAAP EPS: $0.56 (+44%).
    • Non-GAAP EBITDA: $281.1M (+23%).
    • Cash flow ops: $84.5M (-56%).
    • Fiscal Q2 guidance: Solutions revenue: $710M - 730M; non-GAAP EBITDA: $210M - 220M; non-GAAP net income: $80M - 90M.
    • Fiscal 2020 guidance: Solutions revenue growth: 1-2%; non-GAAP EBITDA growth: 6-8%; non-GAAP net income growth: 9-11%.
    • Shares up 8% after hours.
    • Previously: Change Healthcare EPS beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Aug. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • IVR

    Invesco Mortgage said to offer shares at $15.86-$15.96 each

    • Invesco Mortgage's (NYSE:IVR) is said to be offering shares at $15.86 to $15.96 apiece, Bloomberg reports, citing a person familiar with the matter.
    • IVR, which closed down 0.7% today at $16.36, is down 2.2% in after-hours trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech launches equity offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) initiates a public offering of common stock and warrants. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares down 4% after hours.

  • OSTK

    Overstock.com bid down on CEO entanglement concerns

    • Shares of Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) fell 17.58% on the day after CEO Patrick Byrne released a statement on his involvement in the FBI investigation of the 2016 election.
    • The selling pressure might be tied to D.A. Davidson's warning that Byrne's entanglement has the potential to hurt the company's operating results due to the controversial aspects of the issue.
    • Overstock.com ran up a huge gain over the last 60 days before today's stumble.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 28 Comments

    RealReal +17% after first public earnings report

    • The RealReal (NASDAQ:REAL) gains after the retailer posted a smaller-than-anticipated Q2 loss on revenue growth of 51%.
    • Gross merchandise volume rose 40% Y/Y to $65.5M during the quarter, while trailing twelve months active buyers reached also rose 40% to 492,440.
    • Adjusted EBITDA arrived in at -$20.9M vs. -$23.0M consensus.
    • REAL +17.35% AH to $19.95.
    • Previously: The RealReal EPS beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Aug. 13)

  • TLRY

    Tilray Q2 revenues up 371%; shares down 3% after hours on wider-than-expected loss

    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) Q2 results:
    • Revenues: $45.9M (+371%).
    • Adult-use: $15.0M; food products: $19.9M.
    • Kilogram equivalents sold: 5,588 (+269%); average net price per gram: $4.61 (-28%). Decrease due to reduced mix of higher priced extracts and a greater contribution of lower-priced adult-use product.
    • Net loss: ($35.1M); loss/share: ($0.36).
    • Quick assets at quarter-end: $220.9M (-57%).
    • Shares down 3% after hours.
    • Previously: Tilray EPS misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (Aug. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 32 Comments
  • KOOL

    Cesca Therapeutics EPS beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $4.31M (+115.5% Y/Y) beats by $0.91M.

  • DCPH

    Deciphera readies $200M stock offering

    • Wasting no time to capitalize (no pun intended) on today's rally, Deciphera Pharmaceuticals (DCPH +79.9%) launches a $200M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 3% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • RPAY

    Repay climbs 3.1% after pact with Visa Canada

    • Repay Holdings (NASDAQ:RPAY) jumps 3.1% after announcing a partnership with Visa (V +1.2%) Canada that's intended to expand debit card and online payment acceptance for the Canadian personal loans  market.
    • The agreement aims to reduce the complexity of online payments and lower the costs associated with debit card acceptance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • QDEL

    Quidel up 8% as Beckman appeal starts

    • Thinly traded diagnostic test maker Quidel (QDEL +8.3%) is up on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 407K shares, in apparent response to opening arguments in its appeal of a lower court ruling allowing Beckman (DHR +1.5%) to sell certain Quidel-licensed tests directly to customers instead of sourcing them from the company per their agreement.
    • In December 2018, a California state court granted a stay on Beckman's motion for summary judgement.
    • According to MDC Financial's Michael Cohen, the opening statements appear to favor Quidel. A decision from the appeals court should be issued in ~90 days. Quidel remains confident that it will prevail.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM

  • AirPods, Apple Watch won't get tariff extension

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares are approaching the close up 4.4% after the U.S. postponed a tariff on some Chinese goods, including smartphones and laptops. But the tech giant's AirPods, Apple Watch, and HomePod will still fall under the original September 1 deadline for the 10% levy.
    • In the most recent quarter, Wearables and Home contributed $5.5B in revenue.
    • Fitbit's (FIT +3%) wearables will also stay under the original tariff date.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 47 Comments
  • PAM

    Argentina utilities face gloomy outlook, downgrades

    • The outlook for Argentina's energy companies has worsened as Pres. Macri's stunning defeat in a primary election has raised concerns about the return of more intervention in utility prices.
    • Morgan Stanley analysts downgrade shares of Pampa Energia (PAM +0.8%) to Equal Weight from Overweight and Transportadora de Gas del Sur (TGS +8.4%) to Underweight from Equal Weight, saying the stocks likely will "not trade on fundamentals or intrinsic value, but rather more on near term macro-political developments."
    • BTG Pactual cuts PAM and Edenor (EDN -2.5%) to Sell from Neutral and double downgrades TGS to Sell from Buy, noting that on average 98% of the Argentine energy companies' total outstanding debt is linked to the U.S. dollar, but most of their cash flow generation is fully exposed to local demand.
    • The average Sell Side Rating for PAM, which also reported Q2 earnings, is Outperform, while its Quant Rating is Very Bearish.
    • ETF: ARGT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 14 Comments
  • FICO

    Fair Isaac -5.3% as Frannie will consider credit-score alternatives

    • Fair Isaac (NYSE:FICO) slumps 5.3% after the Federal Housing Finance Agency published a final rule today that requires  Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC +2.3%) and Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA +2.7%) to consider alternatives to Fair Isaac's FICO score when assessing a mortgage applicant's creditworthiness.
    • One FICO competitor that's likely to benefit is VantageScore Solutions, which is owned by Equifax (EFX +2.2%), TransUnion (TRU +1%), and Experian (OTCQX:EXPGF +2.1%), reports the Wall Street Journal.
    • The rule becomes effective 60 days after publication in the Federal Register.
    • The rule takes place in four phases -- soliciting applications from credit-score model developers; submission and initial review of submitted applications; credit score assessment; and Enterprise business assessment, in which GSE's evaluate accuracy and reliability of the model within the GSEs' systems, impacts on fair lending, and impact on the mortgage finance industry, among other things..
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 19 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: Sonim Technologies (NASDAQ:SONM) +15%. JD.com (NASDAQ:JD) +14%. GTT Communications (NYSE:GTT) +12%. Phoenix New Media (NYSE:FENG) +11%. NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) +11%.
    • Losers: Covetrus (NASDAQ:CVET) -41%. Polar Power (NASDAQ:POLA) -18%. Summit Wireless Technologies (NASDAQ:WISA) -11%. Workiva (NYSE:WK) -10%. DouYu International Holdings (NASDAQ:DOYU) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • BE

    Bloom Energy crashes as California, New York connection halts spook investors

    • Bloom Energy (BE -41.1%) plunges to all-time lows after reporting solid Q2 results but pre-emptively warning about 2020, largely in connection with a slowdown in domestic commercial and industrial customers.
    • New York and California, two of Bloom's largest markets, have slowed down conversions, so "with fewer orders from those markets in our anticipated mix for 2020, our revenue growth and margins for next year may not be in line with Street expectations," CEO K.R. Sridhar said.
    • BofA Merrill Lynch downgrades shares to Underperform from Neutral with a $6 price target, slashed from $13, noting the company guided to an average selling price decline of 30% Y/Y and to only 30% deployment growth in FY 2020, down from the 40% structural growth previously expected.
    • The company continues to look for "additional input fuels" for its fuel cell systems, "especially those with a lower carbon footprint," Cowen analysts say in maintaining an equivalent of a Neutral rating on the stock and $11 price target.
    • Analysts at Oppenheimer also remain neutral on Bloom, noting the Q2 earnings beat was "driven by international sales and refinancing of replacement" servers.
    • Raymond James analysts led by Pavel Molchanov trim their Bloom price target to $12 from $16 but keep their Buy rating, saying the company's "differentiated technology story needs to be balanced against choppy quarterly metrics and limited financial visibility."
    • BE's average Sell Side Rating is Outperform, its Seeking Alpha Authors Rating is Neutral, and its Quant Rating is Very Bearish.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 13 Comments
  • FB

    Last Oculus co-founder departs Facebook

    • Oculus co-founder Nate Mitchell says he's leaving after seven years -- meaning the co-founder of all Facebook's (FB +2.4%) big acquisitions will have made their exits.
    • Facebook acquired the VR firm for $2B in 2014, and Oculus co-founders Palmer Luckey and Brendan Iribe left the company in 2017 and 2018 respectively.
    • Last April, WhatsApp co-founder Jan Koum announced his departure, and last September, Instagram co-founders Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger made their exits.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 9 Comments

  • PEDEVCO and Ferroglobe among Energy/Materials gainers; Unit Corporation and Americas Silver among losers

    • Gainers: PEDEVCO (NYSEMKT:PED) +51%. Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) +8%. AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) +8%. California Resources (NYSE:CRC) +7%. Diamond Offshore Drilling (NYSE:DO) +6%.
    • Losers: Unit Corporation (NYSE:UNT) -24%. Americas Silver USAS -10%. Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) -7%. Westwater Resources (NASDAQ:WWR) -6%. Endeavour Silver (NYSE:EXK) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM

  • Spotify, Apple nearing Siri truce?

    • Spotify (SPOT +1.8%) and Apple (AAPL +4.3%) are in talks to let iPhone users access SPOT music using Siri voice commands, according to The Information sources.
    • The talks come during a regulatory battle between the companies, which started earlier this year when Spotify filed an EU antitrust complaint about Apple blocking Siri from working with its music streaming competitor.
    • If a truce comes on Siri, the companies could continue to battle on Spotify's other complaints, including Apple's 15-30% commission on app subscriptions.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 9 Comments
  • LOGC

    LogicBio up 20% ahead of IND filing for lead gene therapy candidate

    • Ultra-thinly traded micro cap LogicBio Therapeutics (LOGC +20%) is up on light volume on the heels of its Q2 report released this morning.
    • It expects to file an IND next quarter for lead gene therapy candidate LB-001 for the potential treatment of a rare inherited life-threatening pediatric disorder called methylmalonic acidemia, an "inborn error of metabolism" in which the body is unable to break down certain proteins and fats.
    • Presuming FDA signoff on the filing, a natural history study will be initiated in Q4 followed by the launch of a Phase 1/2 clinical trial in H1 2020. Preliminary data may be available in H2 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 1 Comment

  • RADA Electronic and Chart Industries among industrial gainers; Tecogen only loser

    • Gainers: RADA Electronic (NASDAQ:RADA) +6%. NN  (NASDAQ:NNBR) +6%. Loma Negra Compania (NYSE:LOMA) +6%. William Lyon Homes (NYSE:WLH) +6%. Chart Industries (NASDAQ:GTLS) +5%.
    • Losers: Tecogen (NASDAQ:TGEN) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • JJCTF

    Copper pops after U.S. delays planned new tariffs

    • Copper prices climbed after Pres. Trump walked back plans to impose new tariffs on some Chinese products, which helped ease worries about growth and demand in China.
    • Benchmark copper on the London Metal Exchange settled +1.5% at $5,828.5/mt, after falling to $5,640 last week, the lowest since June 2017.
    • Other base metals also are rising: zinc +1.8% to $2,319/mt, nickel +1.4% to $15,925/mt, aluminum +0.8% to $1,785, lead +0.1% to $2,068, tin +1.6% to $17,100.
    • Among relevant stocks: AKS +6.9%, TX +5.2%, X +4.8%, MT +4.8%, CLF +4.7%, FCX +3.9%, VALE +3.5%, AA +2.8%, TECK +2.5%, CENX +2.5%, SCCO +2.2%, NUE +2.1%, RIO +2%, BHP +1.6%
    • ETFs: JJCTF, COPX, DBB, JJN, CPER, BOM, BDD, JJM, BOS, RJZ, UBM
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 13 Comments

  • Mmtec leads financial gainers, YRIV and VCTR the only losers

    • Gainers: Mmtec (NASDAQ:MTC) +309%. Alcentra Capital (NASDAQ:ABDC) +14%. Genworth Financial (NYSE:GNW) +13%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +12%. IRSA Inversiones  (NYSE:IRS) +12%.
    • Losers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -16%. Victory Capital Holdings (NASDAQ:VCTR) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • Potbelly gains after DoorDash deal

    • Potbelly (PBPB +9.7%) is staging a comeback after last week's devastating post-earnings drop of over 20%.
    • The sandwich chain announced a new nation delivery partnership with DoorDash (DOORD) earlier in the day.
    • Shares of Potbelly are still down 44% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • CIT

    CIT -3.1% as investors prefer buyback vs. deal, Compass Point says

    • CIT Group (NYSE:CIT) slides 3.1% after agreeing to buy Mutual of Omaha's savings bank unit in a $1B deal, likely disappointing investors who wanted CIT to buy back shares instead.
    • Compass Point analyst Scott Valentin says the acquisition is "strategically positive" in that it improves CIT's funding profile and makes its balance sheet more "bank-like."
    • Financially, buying back stock would be more accretive, writes Valentin, who rates the stock at buy with a $62 price target.
    • Deal is likely dilutive to 2020 EPS, he says.
    • Citi analyst Arren Cyganovich, meanwhile, points out that the acquisition adds an attractive low-cost deposit channel and improves profitability.
    • Quant rating Neutral; Sell-Side average rating Outperform (5 Buy, 6 Hold).
    • In the past six months, CIT has declined 5.1% vs. the financial sector median performance of -0.6%.
    • Previously: CIT Group to buy Mutual of Omaha savings bank unit for $1B (Aug. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • ATRC

    AtriCure down 8% on investor coolness to SentreHEART buy

    • Investors appear to lack enthusiasm for AtriCure's (ATRC -8.1%) planned takeover of SentreHEART, the developer of a suture delivery device called LARIAT for left atrial appendage closure.
    • In its press release, the company explains the deal's rationale as being able to provide the "largest possible offering of ablation and left atrial appendage management solutions" given the indications SentreHEART is pursuing in its aMAZE study.
    • Northland Securities' Suraj Kalia is not so sure, citing LARIAT's potential cannibalization of AtriCure's Epi/Endo approach in its CONVERGE trial as well as AtriClip.
    • The left atrial appendage is a small pouchlike sac in the top left chamber of the heart where blood clots tend to form in patients with irregular heartbeats thereby increasing the risk of a stroke. Patients who are unable to take a blood thinner are candidates for closing the appendage.
    • Quant rating is Bullish. Sell side rating is Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM

  • Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Mmtec (NASDAQ:MTC) +346%. Deciphera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DCPH) +87%. PEDEVCO (NYSEMKT:PED) +40%. Mustang Bio (NASDAQ:MBIO) +24%. OptiNose (NASDAQ:OPTN) +22%. LSC Communications (NYSE:LKSD) +21%. Foamix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FOMX) +18%. Jumia Technologies AG (NYSE:JMIA) +17%. Cornerstone Building Brands (NYSE:CNR) +16%. IMAC Holdings (NASDAQ:IMAC) +16%.
    • Losers: Ra Medical Systems (NYSE:RMED) -55%. Covetrus (NASDAQ:CVET) -41%. Bloom Energy Corporation (NYSE:BE) -38%. Unit Corporation (NYSE:UNT) -23%. Arcadia Biosciences (NASDAQ:RKDA) -19%. Nemaura Medical (NASDAQ:NMRD) -18%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics Limited (NASDAQ:YRIV) -17%. Plus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTV) -16%. Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) -15%. Polar Power (NASDAQ:POLA) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM

  • American Axle & Manufacturing leads consumer gainers; SunOpta among losers

    • Gainers: American Axle & Manufacturing (NYSE:AXL) +8%. Libbey (NYSEMKT:LBY) +7%. Caleres (NYSE:CAL) +7%. Cooper-Standard (NYSE:CPS) +7%. Suzano (NYSE:SUZ) +7%.
    • Losers: Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) -8%. SunOpta (NASDAQ:STKL) -7%. Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft hires Samsung vet as healthcare head

    • Microsoft (MSFT +1.7%) hires David Rhew as the Chief Medical Officer and VP of healthcare for its Worldwide Commercial Business.
    • Rhew, a medical doctor and computer scientist, previously served as the CMO at Samsung.
    • Source: Bloomberg.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • WMT

    Spotlight on Walmart's margins

    • Gordon Haskett analyst Chuck Grom is positive (Accumulate, $115 price target) on Walmart (WMT +2.1%) just ahead of the company's Q2 earnings report due out on Thursday.
    • Grom has his eyes on margins in particular, noting the market has yet to fully appreciate the inflection in margins. He sees upward earning revisions if the WMT margin momentum continues.
    • Street expectations for Walmart's Q2: Revenue $129B, EPS $1.22, U.S. comparable sales +2.4%, gross margin 24.5% of sales, operating margin 4.3% of sales.
    • Shares of Walmart are up 7.0% since the Q1 earnings report dropped.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 8 Comments
  • CTL

    CenturyLink gets $550,000 FCC fine for cramming

    • CenturyLink (CTL +3.4%) has agreed to a $550,000 fine from the FCC over allegations of cramming.
    • The settlement includes CenturyLink committing to provide refunds to customers tied to the unauthorized third-party charges and fees placed on their bills.
    • CenturyLink will cease billing for third parties with only narrow exceptions. Customers will also get an easier path to disputing unauthorized charges (they previously had to first contact the third party, or to pay disputed fees until a dispute was resolved).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 22 Comments
  • NVDA

    RBC trims Nvidia target before earnings

    • RBC maintains an Outperform rating on Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) and lowers the target from $200 to $190.
    • Nvidia will report earnings after the bell on Thursday. Consensus estimates expect $2.55B in revenue with $1.15 EPS.
    • NVDA shares are up 2.7% to $155.59 as the tech sector reacts to the delayed U.S. tariff on some Chinese goods. Nvidia has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 24 Comments
  • TTEK

    Tetra Tech secures two U.S. EPA Superfund contracts valued at $132M

    • Tetra Tech (TTEK +1.1%) announced it has been awarded two single-award, five-year contracts by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, to provide technical and advisory services in Regions 4 and 5 for the Superfund Technical Assessment and Response Team.
    • The two contracts have a combined value of $132M. Tetra Tech will perform services including field surveys, contingency planning, Superfund and brownfields site assessments, human health and ecological risk assessments, data management and mapping, and training.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ZLAB

    Zai Lab up 7% accelerated review status for Optune in China

    • Thinly traded Zai Lab (ZLAB +6.5%) is up below-average volume. Yesterday, it announced that the China National Products Administration granted accelerated review status, called Innovative Medical Device Designation, for Optune (Tumor Treating Fields).
    • The company launched Optune in Hong Kong in December 2018 for the treatment of glioblastoma multiforme (brain tumor).
    • Update: The buying is also appears to be related to the rally in Deciphera Pharmaceuticals after it announced positive late-stage data on ripretinib this morning. ZLAB owns commercialization rights to the broad-spectrum KIT and PDGFRα inhibitor in greater China under an agreement inked in June.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 4 Comments

  • Nexstar Media +3% as Stephens' new best idea

    • Nexstar Media Group (NASDAQ:NXST) is up 3% after replacing CBS as Stephens' best idea.
    • A double-digit decline from April has made an "attractive entry point" for shares in a media company that's about to close on its acquisition of Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO).
    • And the closure of that deal will represent a valuation catalyst in the near term and an operational catalyst in the long view, analyst Kyle Evans writes.
    • The firm has an Overweight rating and a $150 price target, implying a healthy 48.8% upside.

  • Price check on rails vs. trucks

    • While trucking and railroad stocks are broadly gaining today off positive trade news, IHS Markit is out with some interesting analysis on the the pricing differential between the two modes of transportation.
    • IHS Markit says U.S. railroads saw another drop in their pricing advantage for domestic intermodal shipping in comparison to trucking.
    • IHS: "The dwindling pricing advantage means that there is less financial incentive for shippers to transport cargo 'intermodal'—that is via rail, where it is onloaded and offloaded by trucks—rather than just utilizing trucking for the entire length of the trip. Shippers compare transit times, on-time performance, and total cost between intermodal (truck and rail) and just trucks when deciding how to move their freight."
    • The firm notes that U.S. railroads face slowing freight growth and U.S. trucking spare capacity increases, creating a new buying dynamic for U.S. shippers moving goods via 53-foot containers and trailers.
    • Railroad/trucking stocks: Union Pacific (UNP +1.8%), Norfolk Southern (NSC +2.3%), CSX Corporation (CSX +1.1%), Canadian National Railway (CNI +0.7%), Canadian Pacific (CP +2.1%), Kansas City Southern (KSU +2.2%), Wabtec (WBC -0.1%), Trinity Industries (TRN +1.6%), Knight-Swift Transportation (KNX +5.3%), ArcBest (ARCB +4.1%), Schneider National (SNDR +3.3%), J.B. Hunt Transport (JBHT +2.6%), Covenant Transportation (CVTI +2.2%), Heartland Express (HTLD +2.3%), USA Truck (USAK +2.6%), Landstar Systems (LSTR +2.4%), Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL +2.5%), Marten Transport (MRTN +2.2%), Werner Enterprises (WERN +1.4%), YRC Worldwide (YRCW +1.1%).
